If you're a B. Burke fan, you just have to have this in your dvd collection, its not that great of a dvd....but its not that bad either!

Being a big fan of Brooke Burke---after watching her on "Wild On!", buying the 2004 calendar, purchasing every FHM, Stuff or Maxim that had her on the cover...........I was happy to buy the DVD. However the DVD is just a poorly-done documentary on Brooke Burke, offering her annoying commentary over swimsuit shots done to a bad soundtrack. Like most other models, she is stuck-up, conceded, and too used to getting her own way and having no true challenges lying ahead of her. I'd take WWE's amazing Trish Stratus over Brooke anyday. Trish goes through much larger challenges than Brooke daily, in wrestling matches. Brooke wouldn't fare too well in that department. As for her looks, she is very very hot, but this DVD just brings it all down. It was truly a waste of money spent on this poor video.

Bottom line, it [stinks]...I don't see how anyone could enjoy this unless the type of person that would stalk her..Didn't hold My attention for more than 10 minutes.
Don't waste your money.

Brooke Burke.  Lovely girl. Can't act. Probably can't sing or dance, either.  All she can do is look hot in a swimsuit, but she does that very well.
Problem is, this DVD isn't terribly interesting.  It plays like an episode of Showtime's "Red Shoe Diaries", except without any titillating elements.  All you get is the goofy music, exotic yet curiously drab locales, slo-mo effects of her walking along the beach, road, or whatever, and a lot of pretentious voice-over narration.
Not too many years ago, Brooke exuded a deliciously sexy pixie-ish quality.  But now she is a tad overexposed, pun intended.  An all-nude Playboy layout in 2001 revealed her newly ripped and bosom-enhanced body, but failed to capture the sexuality that made her so remarkable in her earlier modeling years.
This DVD is another confusing step in her quest to be the ubiquitous Uber-babe.  But it is too much style, not enough substance.  You really would need to be a die-hard Brooke junkie to be pleased with this disc.  It is "too much" and "not enough" all at the same time.
I was quite taken with Brooke when I first discovered her around 1995.  So it pains me quite a bit to have to say less-than-flattering things about this vanity project of hers. But this video seems to have little purpose other than just getting her face on your TV screen.  And the superfluous Enrique Eglasias video at the end?  Cheesy.

Fantastic getaway! I have to admit, I just wanted something that inspired summertime for me. This did it. Seeing her modeling her swimsuits and going to exotic beaches is a great mind getaway and very inspiring for summer. If you want to be inspired to be on a beach or get in swimsuit shape, this was really a good motivator. I like the added bonus where she goes on a vacay alone to a beach - sort of every girl's fantasy.
Did not show Brooke naked even once.  Don't waste your money.
